017package org.microbean.invoke;
018
019import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
020import java.util.Objects;
021import java.util.Optional;
022
023import java.util.function.BiFunction;
024import java.util.function.Consumer;
025import java.util.function.Function;
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027import java.util.function.Supplier;
028
029import java.util.stream.Stream;
030
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
033import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
034
035/**
036 * A {@link DeterministicSupplier} with additional contractual
037 * requirements.
038 *
039 * <p>An {@link OptionalSupplier} does not behave like an {@link
040 * Optional} or a {@link java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture},
041 * despite the deliberate similarities of some methods.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>An implementation of this interface is not a <a
044 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
045 * class</a>.</p>
046 *
047 * @param <T> the type of value implementations of this interface
048 * {@linkplain #get() supply}
049 *
050 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
051 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
052 *
053 * @see #get()
054 *
055 * @see DeterministicSupplier#deterministic()
056 *
057 * @see #optional()
058 */
059@FunctionalInterface
060public interface OptionalSupplier<T> extends DeterministicSupplier<T> {
061
062  /**
063   * Returns either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
064   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
065   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
066   * supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException} that
067   * does occur.
068   *
069   * @param handler the exception handler; must not be {@code null}
070   *
071   * @return either the result of invoking the {@link #get()} method,
072   * if a {@link RuntimeException} does not occur, or the result of
073   * invoking the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method on the
074   * supplied {@code handler} with any {@link RuntimeException} that
075   * does occur
076   *
077   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
078   * null}
079   *
080   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}
081   *
082   * @idempotency This method is not guaranteed to be idempotent or
083   * deterministic.
084   *
085   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
086   * multiple threads, but the {@link #get()} method may not be, and
087   * the {@link Function#apply(Object)} method of the supplied {@code
088   * handler} may not be.
089   */
090  @OverridingDiscouraged
091  public default T exceptionally(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
092    try {
093      return this.get();
094    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
095      return handler.apply(e);
096    }
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns a value, which may be {@code null}, indicating (possibly
101   * transitory) <em>emptiness</em>, or non-{@code null}, indicating
102   * (possibly transitory) <em>presence</em>.
103   *
104   * <p>This method's contract extends {@link Supplier#get()}'s
105   * contract with the following additional requirements:</p>
106   *
107   * <ul>
108   *
109   * <li>An implementation of this method need not be deterministic.</li>
110   *
111   * <li>An implementation of this method may indicate (possibly
112   * transitory) emptiness by any of the following means:
113   *
114   * <ul><li>Returning {@code null}.  The emptiness is
115   * <em>transitory</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of this method
116   * may return a non-{@code null} result.</li>
117   *
118   * <li>Throwing a {@link NoSuchElementException}.  The emptiness is
119   * <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations of this
120   * method will (must) also throw an {@link
121   * NoSuchElementException}.</li>
122   *
123   * <li>Throwing an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.  The
124   * emptiness is <em>permanent</em>, i.e. all subsequent invocations
125   * of this method will (must) also throw an {@link
126   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
127   *
128   * </ul></li>
129   *
130   * <li>The returning of a non-{@code null} value indicates (only)
131   * <em>transitory presence</em>, i.e. a subsequent invocation of
132   * this method may return {@code null} or throw either a {@link
133   * NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
134   * UnsupportedOperationException}.</li>
135   *
136   * </ul>
137   *
138   * @return a value, or {@code null} to indicate transitory emptiness
139   *
140   * @exception NoSuchElementException to indicate permanent emptiness
141   *
142   * @exception UnsupportedOperationException to indicate permanent
143   * emptiness
144   *
145   * @nullability Implementations of this method may and often will
146   * return {@code null}, indicating transitory emptiness.
147   *
148   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
149   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
150   *
151   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
152   * but need not be deterministic.  However, once an implementation
153   * of this method throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or
154   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, it must also do so for
155   * every subsequent invocation.
156   */
157  @Override
158  public T get();
159
160  /**
161   * Invokes the {@link #get()} method and handles either the result
162   * or any {@link RuntimeException}s that are thrown using the
163   * supplied {@link BiFunction}.
164   *
165   * <p>The first argument to the handler will be the return value of
166   * the {@link #get()} method, which may be {@code null}.  The second
167   * argument to the handler will be any {@link RuntimeException} that
168   * was thrown during the invocation of the {@link #get()}
169   * method.</p>
170   *
171   * @param <U> the type of the value returned
172   *
173   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
174   *
175   * @return the return value of the supplied {@code handler}'s {@link
176   * BiFunction#apply(Object, Object)} method, which may be {@code
177   * null}
178   *
179   * @nullability The default implementation of this method and its
180   * overrides may return {@code null}.
181   *
182   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
183   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
184   *
185   * @idempotency No guarantees about either idempotency or
186   * determinism are made.
187   */
188  @OverridingDiscouraged
189  public default <U> U handle(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
190    try {
191      return handler.apply(this.get(), null);
192    } catch (final RuntimeException e) {
193      return handler.apply(null, e);
194    }
195  }
196
197  /**
198   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method on the
199   * supplied {@code action} with the return value of an invocation of
200   * the {@link #get()} method, unless the {@link #get()} method
201   * throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or an {@link
202   * UnsupportedOperationException}, in which case no action is taken.
203   *
204   * @param action the {@link Consumer} representing the action to
205   * take; must not be {@code null}
206   *
207   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} is {@code null}
208   *
209   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
210   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
211   * may not be.
212   *
213   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
214   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
215   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be
216   *
217   * @see #get()
218   */
219  @Convenience
220  @OverridingDiscouraged
221  public default void ifPresent(final Consumer<? super T> action) {
222    try {
223      action.accept(this.get());
224    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
225    }
226  }
227
228  /**
229   * Invokes the {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method on the
230   * supplied {@code presentAction} with the return value of an
231   * invocation of the {@link #get()} method, unless the {@link
232   * #get()} method throws either a {@link NoSuchElementException} or
233   * an {@link UnsupportedOperationException}, in which case the
234   * {@link Runnable#run()} method of the supplied {@code
235   * absentAction} is invoked instead.
236   *
237   * @param presentAction the {@link Consumer} representing the action
238   * to take if a value is present; must not be {@code null}
239   *
240   * @param absentAction the {@link Runnable} representing the action
241   * to take if a value is absent; must not be {@code null}
242   *
243   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code action} or {@code
244   * emptyAction} is {@code null}
245   *
246   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
247   * idempotent and deterministic, but the supplied {@link Consumer}
248   * and {@link Runnable} may not be.
249   *
250   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
251   * concurrent use by multiple threads, but the supplied {@link
252   * Consumer}'s {@link Consumer#accept(Object)} method may not be and
253   * the supplied {@link Runnable}'s {@link Runnable#run()} method may
254   * not be
255   *
256   * @see #get()
257   */
258  @Convenience
259  @OverridingDiscouraged
260  public default void ifPresentOrElse(final Consumer<? super T> presentAction, final Runnable absentAction) {
261    try {
262      presentAction.accept(this.get());
263    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
264      absentAction.run();
265    }
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Returns a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
270   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
271   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}.
272   *
273   * <p>The default implementation of this method does not and its
274   * overrides must not return {@code null}.</p>
275   *
276   * <p>The default implementation of this method catches all {@link
277   * NoSuchElementException}s and {@link
278   * UnsupportedOperationException}s and returns an empty {@link
279   * Optional} in these cases, which may not be valid for some use
280   * cases.  To detect permanent versus transitory absence, potential
281   * callers should use the {@link #get()} method directly or either
282   * the {@link #optional(Function)} or {@link #optional(BiFunction)}
283   * methods.</p>
284   *
285   * @return a non-{@code null} but possibly {@linkplain
286   * Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link Optional} representing this
287   * {@link OptionalSupplier}'s {@linkplain #get() value}
288   *
289   * @nullability The default implementation of this method does not
290   * and overrides must not return {@code null}.
291   *
292   * @threadsafety The default implementation of this method is and
293   * overrides must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
294   *
295   * @idempotency The default implementation and overrides of this
296   * method may not be idempotent or deterministic.
297   *
298   * @see #optional(BiFunction)
299   *
300   * @see #get()
301   */
302  @Convenience
303  @OverridingDiscouraged
304  public default Optional<T> optional() {
305    return this.optional(OptionalSupplier::returnNull);
306  }
307
308  /**
309   * Invokes the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method, supplying it with
310   * the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to the
311   * {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
312   * result.
313   *
314   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Optional}
315   *
316   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
317   *
318   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
319   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
320   * value of invoking the {@link #handle(BiFunction)} method with the
321   * supplied {@code handler}
322   *
323   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
324   * null}
325   *
326   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
327   * return {@code null}.
328   *
329   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
330   * idempotent and deterministic.
331   *
332   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
333   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
334   *
335   * @see #handle(BiFunction)
336   *
337   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
338   */
339  @Convenience
340  @OverridingDiscouraged
341  public default <U> Optional<U> optional(final BiFunction<? super T, ? super RuntimeException, ? extends U> handler) {
342    return Optional.ofNullable(this.handle(handler));
343  }
344
345  /**
346   * Invokes the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method, supplying it
347   * with the supplied {@code handler}, supplies its return value to
348   * the {@link Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method, and returns the
349   * result.
350   *
351   * @param handler the handler; must not be {@code null}
352   *
353   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
354   * Optional#ofNullable(Object)} method supplied with the return
355   * value of invoking the {@link #exceptionally(Function)} method
356   * with the supplied {@code handler}
357   *
358   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code handler} is {@code
359   * null}
360   *
361   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
362   * return {@code null}.
363   *
364   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
365   * idempotent and deterministic.
366   *
367   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
368   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
369   *
370   * @see #exceptionally(Function)
371   *
372   * @see Optional#ofNullable(Object)
373   */
374  @Convenience
375  @OverridingDiscouraged
376  public default Optional<T> optional(final Function<? super RuntimeException, ? extends T> handler) {
377    return Optional.ofNullable(this.exceptionally(handler));
378  }
379
380  /**
381   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return
382   * value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the
383   * supplied {@code other}, and returns the result.
384   *
385   * @param other the alternate value; may be {@code null}
386   *
387   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
388   * Optional#orElse(Object)} method on the return value of the {@link
389   * #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
390   * other}
391   *
392   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
393   *
394   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
395   *
396   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
397   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
398   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
399   *
400   * @see #optional()
401   *
402   * @see Optional#orElse(Object)
403   */
404  @Convenience
405  @OverridingDiscouraged
406  public default T orElse(final T other) {
407    try {
408      return this.get();
409    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
410      return other;
411    }
412  }
413
414  /**
415   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the
416   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
417   * the supplied {@code supplier}, and returns the result.
418   *
419   * @param supplier the alternate value {@link Supplier}; must not be
420   * {@code null}
421   *
422   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
423   * Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
424   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
425   * supplier}
426   *
427   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
428   * null}
429   *
430   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
431   *
432   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
433   *
434   * @threadsafety This method itself is safe for concurrent use by
435   * multiple threads, but the {@link Supplier#get()} method of the
436   * supplied {@code supplier} may not be
437   *
438   * @see #optional()
439   *
440   * @see Optional#orElseGet(Supplier)
441   */
442  @Convenience
443  @OverridingDiscouraged
444  public default T orElseGet(final Supplier<? extends T> supplier) {
445    try {
446      return this.get();
447    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
448      return supplier.get();
449    }
450  }
451
452  /**
453   * Invokes the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)} method with {@link
454   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
455   * NoSuchElementException::new} and returns the result.
456   *
457   * @return the result of invoking the {@link #orElseThrow(Supplier)}
458   * method with {@link
459   * NoSuchElementException#NoSuchElementException()
460   * NoSuchElementException::new}
461   *
462   * @exception NoSuchElementException if the {@link #optional()}
463   * method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty} {@link
464   * Optional}
465   *
466   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
467   * never return, {@code null}.
468   *
469   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be, as
470   * idempotent and deterministic as the {@link #optional()} method.
471   *
472   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
473   * concurrent use by multiple threads
474   *
475   * @see #orElseThrow(Supplier)
476   */
477  @Convenience
478  @OverridingDiscouraged
479  public default T orElseThrow() {
480    try {
481      return this.get();
482    } catch (final UnsupportedOperationException e) {
483      throw new NoSuchElementException(e.getMessage(), e);
484    }
485  }
486
487  /**
488   * Invokes the {@link Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the
489   * return value of the {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with
490   * the supplied {@code throwableSupplier}, and returns the result.
491   *
492   * @param <X> the type of {@link Throwable} the supplied {@code
493   * throwableSupplier} {@linkplain Supplier#get() supplies}
494   *
495   * @param throwableSupplier the {@link Throwable} {@link Supplier};
496   * must not be {@code null}
497   *
498   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
499   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method on the return value of the
500   * {@link #optional()} method, supplying it with the supplied {@code
501   * throwableSupplier}
502   *
503   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supplier} is {@code
504   * null}
505   *
506   * @exception X (actually {@code <X>}) if the {@link
507   * #optional()} method returns an {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty()
508   * empty} {@link Optional} and the {@link
509   * Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)} method throws an exception
510   *
511   * @nullability This method never returns, and its overrides must
512   * never return, {@code null}.
513   *
514   * @idempotency This method is and its overrides must be idempotent
515   * and deterministic.
516   *
517   * @threadsafety This method itself is, and its overrides must be,
518   * safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
519   *
520   * @see #optional()
521   *
522   * @see Optional#orElseThrow(Supplier)
523   */
524  @Convenience
525  @OverridingDiscouraged
526  public default <X extends Throwable> T orElseThrow(final Supplier<? extends X> throwableSupplier) throws X {
527    try {
528      return this.get();
529    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
530      final X throwable = throwableSupplier.get();
531      if (throwable.getCause() == null) {
532        throwable.initCause(e);
533      } else {
534        throwable.addSuppressed(e);
535      }
536      throw throwable;
537    }
538  }
539
540  /**
541   * Invokes the {@link Optional#stream()} method on the return value
542   * of the {@link #optional()} method, and returns the result.
543   *
544   * @return the result of invoking the {@link
545   * Optional#stream()} method on the return value of the
546   * {@link #optional()} method
547   *
548   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
549   * return {@code null}.
550   *
551   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
552   * idempotent and deterministic.
553   *
554   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
555   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
556   *
557   * @see #optional()
558   *
559   * @see Optional#stream()
560   */
561  @Convenience
562  @OverridingDiscouraged
563  public default Stream<T> stream() {
564    try {
565      return Stream.of(this.get());
566    } catch (final NoSuchElementException | UnsupportedOperationException e) {
567      return Stream.empty();
568    }
569  }
570
571  private static <T> T returnNull(final RuntimeException e) {
572    if (e instanceof NoSuchElementException || e instanceof UnsupportedOperationException) {
573      return null;
574    } else {
575      throw e;
576    }
577  }
578
579}
